ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A great class to learn about the financial crisis and develop the tools to actually understand the implications and things you read in the WSJ or Fin Times.
This course helped improve my reading and writing skills through macro analysis of disruptive economic, political, and technological trends.
I learned many skills necessary to have a high level conversation about global finance with any expert.
Global finance - history, organizations, policy Technology in global policy

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: interesting, engaging, updated with current issues Improvements: choose one or two topics to delve deeper

The strengths: 1. we learnt about the most relevant and current topics of the global financial system 2. we were trained to argument about different topics 3. we had to read papers/documents/articles and watch videos of important actors of the global financial systems 4. Professor Garten is great and his assistants as well, always helped us when needed. Weaknesses: 1. Just one class per week of 3hs is quite intense 2. The homework was just making summaries, sometimes having questions to answer or a particular assginment maybe could guide us better

Strengths: Course Instructor is excellent Very Well structured course Grand Overview of the topic Weakness: Technological developments were discussed for less than two hours in the class. The readings in technology & global finance - were not adequate. Emerging economies was dealt for less than two hours. The readings were highly inadequate in this subtopic.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: ABSOLUTELY! Take this class if you can. Great survey of topics on the frontier of finance.
I would recommend this course to any student regardless their background since it involves a lot of general knowledge and understanding of the important current issues.

Highly recommend this course to students aspiring to have a broad overview of the topic. But this is not the most relevant course for those who are looking for expertise in specific topics such as - Emerging economies or Fintech
